title: Percy Williams (New Zealand rugby league player)
text:
Percy Williams was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played representative rugby league (RL) for <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a>.
Early years.
Williams originally played <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> for the City club in Auckland and represented <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20union%20team">Auckland</a>.
Playing career.
He played club rugby for City in Auckland and also played for the Auckland representative team. He was signed by Wigan in August, 1910.
Williams played for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> for three seasons between 1910/11 to 1912/13. During this time he played in 111 matches for the club in the Lancashire League, including in the 1911 <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final loss.
In 1913 he was called into the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand squad</a>, joining them midway through their <a href="1913%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Australia">tour of Australia</a>. He had been returning to New Zealand from England at the time. Williams was said to be instrumental in New Zealand's 17-11 upset victory over <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a>.
Williams returned to New Zealand after the tour and in 1914 he played 7 matches for the <a href="City%20Rovers">City Rovers</a> club in Auckland before announcing his retirement before the start of the 1915 season.
